availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John M. Moore (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee Native. Son of Elizabeth Moore. Married to Seraphina A. Moore Moore on February 12, 1852 in Wilson County, Tennessee. Father of Samuel Moore, Martha Moore, David Moore, James Moore, Rufus Moore, Cornelia Moore, Houston J. Moore, and Sarah Moore. Resident of Wilson County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farmer in Fredonia, Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed S.W. Moore as a farmhand in Fredonia in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States_ (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Wilson County, District 22, p. 476A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p. 178.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p. 442a.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Tennessee, Microfilm. p.340.
"John M. Moore (1831-1881)," Find A Grave, Memorial #46291105, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46291105/john-marion-moore (accessed March 2, 2021).
